key_dates.description: Second turning point. Dense zone Aug 12-13.

seasonal: August generally positive (bullish) for Gold. Seasonally favorable.

statistics.description: Gold closed higher on Aug 12 vs Aug 5 in ~70% of 30 years.

insights: Bullish seasonal month. Four key stat dates with 67-74% probabilities.
ATH on ~Aug 21.04. Elliott Wave 5 potentially ending 2022 uptrend.
Market advanced in rally - hard to estimate precise top at ATH.
Every decline is technical correction before continuation in current uptrend.
If inverted N-pattern on weekly chart = deepest decline in 2.5 years.
Fibonacci AB-CD: point D at $3,516 (April resistance). Rally from April may be correction we receive soon.
Dropped to 38.2% Fib ($3,134) in May, immediate bounce. Symmetric triangle possible.
Break above: next target $3,782 (Fib extension). Break below: $3,080 support.
Weekly Elliott Wave: wave 5 ending upward cycle from end 2022. Last strong support $3,250.
Dates Aug 22 and 29 particularly strong. Aug 19-22 and 29 align with weekly cycles.

support.description: Last strong support from recent action.
April resistance / Fib point D in AB-CD.

technical.indicators: Elliott Wave 5 on weekly. Fib AB-CD point D at $3,516. 38.2% at $3,134 held May. Symmetric triangle possible. Daily shows clear support/resistance with key dates aligning weekly cycles.

summary: Gold August 2025: bullish seasonal bias with four turning points (Aug 5, 12, 21, 29). At ATH in Elliott Wave 5. Mixed stats: Aug 4 (70% down), Aug 6 (67% up), Aug 14 (73% down), Aug 26 (74% up). Support $3,250/$3,134 critical. Upside target $3,782.
previous_month_review: July: 4 dates all worked well. 01.07=low (-1 day), upward continuation. 10-11.07=high, narrow range decline 4 days then reversal. 21-22.07=arrived at triangle/square resistance, classic -4.5% decline to month end. 30.07=on support, possible low.
risk_notes: At ATH - precise top hard to estimate.
Elliott Wave 5 ending risk = significant correction possible.
Inverted N on weekly = deepest decline in 2.5 years.
Fib 38.2% at $3,134 critical. Below = deeper correction to $3,080.
Dense turning points Aug 13-18 overlap with S&P - cross-asset volatility.
